Well let me start by saying i agree with all of the reviews i have read already...but let me start with one obvious problem i have always had with buffet style restaurants...THE CARPET....UHHHHHH!!!!!! I mean if these establishment are going to have carpet in a public area with kids present and people generally eating like kids...then you must pay close attention to the CARPET!!!!. The CARPET had a horrible smell at this location...and you really have to be careful not to let it ruin your appetite.Secondly for the $25 price tag...if your not going for some sort of special...like the all you can eat ribs....which no one else does...then it may not be worth your money. This evening...because my wife loves ribs...is why we even went to pay this establishment a visit. Now don't get me wrong the food is very good...not great...but very good. I had a fabulous piece of rotisserie chicken breast with mashed potatoes and gravy...mac and cheese....and dinner rolls. My wife had the ribs of course.... along with various sides.Now the dessert is not so great or very good for that matter. I had the lemon tart....brownie...and vanilla-chocolate swirl yogurt...and all of them were awful. My wife had the lemon cake and vanilla ice cream along with some fresh strawberries and she seemed to enjoy it.Now in conclusion i don't have to go here again personally...but if a special deal comes to this establishment and you really like it you should definitely give it a shot....otherwise pay your $25 to eat somewhere else. Eat

column3: and be Merry my friends!!!!~~#~0

column49: little effort on amenities and full attention to stocked taps and bar specials.  I was expecting a generous variety of Oyster dishes to choose from. The salmon on the other hand was just the way I like it. Bottom Line -  I did go during happy hour (not purposely) and no one was really eating (except my face) but everyone was drinking and having a good time.  Go there for the booze is my best advice and keep the food in mind as an after thought.  It wasn't bad by all means but it wasn't something I would go out of my way to eat again.Avg dinner price was $20 per person with no drinks.~~#~0

column1: Where do I start with Casey Moores? The food is freaking fantastic. I'm from Boston and their clam chowder is in my top 3 favorites. Their fried clam strips are equally awesome. It's a good place to meet up with friends for drinks or even just a place to hang out at all night. It's got an awesome outdoor patio as well. But the service even during the day can be pretty shitty and the bouncers can be equally as shitty. Since it's close to ASU they inspect and reinspect ID's and they have been known to hassle patrons. Another drawback they start carding way early. Most bar/pub/restaurants don't start carding until about 9. I brought a friend for a late dinner once at around 7 and the bouncer was already checking ID's so she couldn't get in. But inside it's usually a pretty good crowd and you'll always see a familiar face.~~#~0

column24: I don't remember being to p'ed off with my bill for the burger and a drink. Decent Chandler type prices
column25: I guess. So yeah
column26: if you got a girl
column27: take her here and be wary of the trained male waiters. Order some of the nicer things on the menu
column28: not a stupid burger. And for us guys who like to wear jeans and a t-shirt
column29: you can do so here...just make sure its a decent t-shirt
column30: one without the set in stains. And bring at least 20 bucks...trust me.~~#~0

column1: OK
column2: I know Benni's is more known for their Teppanyaki but for an uppity Japanese place you'd expect the sushi to be equally as good right? Meh. Not only did it suck
column3: but the selection was limited
column4: they were 'out' of many items
column5: and it was overpriced. I don't recommend it. The company at our table included a young couple celebrating a birthday and an extremely douchey
column6: divorced father/daughter duo that did not stop arguing the ENTIRE time. The girl was huffing and whining about her mercedes not being the model she had hoped for
column7: elbows all over the table. The dad was talking very loud and using profanity
column8: blaming the mom and calling her and the girl insulting names. It took everything in my power not to walk over and politely ask the guy to leave our table because I know it would have escalated. So after a bit the guy picked up on the rest of us at the table looking perturbed and he apologized
column9: but still kept arguing
column10: only a little quieter now. Enter chef: a Mexican fellow with an exotic Latin romance novel name I can't remember. He introduced himself and Julie jokingly asked if his name was Japanese. He laughed and was actually a good sport about it
column11: injecting little bits of hispanic humor throughout the cooking experience...and offered to serve Julie her chicken open-faced or wrapped in a burrito if she preferred :) He wasn't all that impressive with his knife work and tossing tricks which we didn't really care about but it's still expected
column12: especially for the kids (and the price). The food however was cooked to perfection and more than made up for the sub par sushi. He made it a point to give the arguing d-bags sample pieces first so they'd have something to occupy their mouths
column13: and winked at the rest of us which was pretty cool. All in all it was a fairly entertaining evening
column14: and aside from the sushi the rest of the food was awesome. The Saki and Kirin helped take the edge off and toward the end the whole table was talking and being friendly
column15: and we even got to bomb the birthday girl's photo op haha. Btw
column16: if birthday girl or someone that knows her reads this
column17: we would like a copy of that photo!! We tried to download it from the Benihana website but of course they were having 'technical difficulties' with it that night. Hmm I wonder if their sushi chef doubles as their web developer?~~#~0

column1: Umm....  I didn't like it.  Apparently I'm the only one?We went to Sweet Republic last night
column2: drove 30 minutes because 141 reviews and a 5 star rating was reason enough.  I'm a little perplexed by the rating
column3: I keep thinking I must have ordered the wrong flavors?We tried the salted butter carmel
column4: rocky road and malt with chocolate waffle cone.  I didn't really care for any of them.  The flavor was so mild that I felt completely unsatisfied.  So unsatisfied that we ended up leaving and driving to Yogurtology to do the job of filling our sweet tooth.I won't be back...~~#~0

column1: Wild Thaiger was very cozy and inviting. This was my first time eating Thai food so I was looking to have a great experience unfortunately the service or lack there of almost ruined it for me. They were not very busy but it took about 10 minutes for the hostess to seat us. The server took another 15 minutes to take our drink order. The Thai iced tea was really different but very good. We ordered some chicken egg rolls and when they finally came or they were amazing! Our main dishes took forever to come out and it was just ok. I think I like Thai food.but I will not be returning here.~~#~0
I have been living here for almost two years now
column2: when my husband and I first moved in it was great! Everyone in the office was awesome and the maintenance workers really cared. Since Greystar has taken over they are giving incentive to let inconsiderate tenants move in. I have been dreading living here since then. I have complained time and time again about hood rat kids with their subwoofers
column3: drug dealers making deals in broad daylight in front of me! I was flabbergasted when I first saw this happen! Don't get me wrong
column4: the inside of the apartments are very nice
column5: new sinks
column6: stove
column7: refrigerator
column8: and new microwave. Since the management has taken over the new maintenance workers half ass work
column9: the people in the office are rude ( they also have a lady that cannot properly dress
column10: she looks like she's going to the club in her hoochie clothes
column11: instead wearing business attire.) I for one would not recommend this place
column12: they are about to raise the rent to $675.00 a month! This is not worth it! Find somewhere else!~~#~0

column1: Ok
column2: I have to be a stickler on this one. We were looking for a reasonable hike on our day off to get a little exercise and be outdoors in Phoenix while there on vacation. SG checked some other sites for listings
column3: not looking at YELP. If he had
column4: he would have noticed that all the reviews
column5: though highly rated
column6: talk about the high intensity and rocky terrain. The other sites said "easy to moderate". Uh huh
column7: right. So
column8: we found a rock star parking spot on the little street leading up to the park entrance and did not wait for the line to allow one person at a time into the lot. That would have took a half hour on its own. We ventured up and started into the park. Fairly quickly you get into ROCKY terrain with some definite climbing. Ok
column9: so maybe this is just a little bit of the hike. NOPE. Pretty much the whole thing! I really did not have much trouble with going up this mountain. I would not say that I could or would ever want to run it (or do it twice
column10: three times
column11: or 4 times like some of the folks on the trail)
column12: but I am in ok shape to breath heavy and keep going. SG on the other hand was not in shape for this mountain. Going down
column13: I was the pokey chicken. I do not like going down. I would rather sweat and breath hard going up all day long. This rocky terrain is treacherous. I myself am too timid for this type of descent. I would have preferred a non rocky hike
column14: even with the elevation gain. Just be warned.~~#~0

column1: The scene was great but the food and drinks were not. I ordered a steak and it came out under cooked and pre sliced. My boyfriend loved his champagne drink but the martini and wine were not good. It's funny that the wine was not good at a place that says they are a wine bar. Will we go back? Maybe
column2: but it won't be our first choice. There are better places downtown that has more consistent food.~~#~0

column1: Great place for happy hour.There's not much going on at City North except for the restaurants and bars.  Kona Grill is the place for decent food and cheap drinks for happy hour.This last visit my friend and I ordered the fried calamari and a Hawaiian pizza.  Both were pretty good and enough to fill us up.The Sam Adams seasonal beer was served in chilled beer glasses which was a nice touch.Sitting at the bar talking with friends
column2: watching TV and having fun people watching is the way to go.~~#~0

column1: First timers with a large party. Everybody liked food and service except the halibut was awful.~~#~0
My friends like The Parlor more than I do. That's not to say it's sub-par
column2: but rather they gush about it so profusely that there's no way it can live up to the hype. (Note: I talk about expectations a lot because it's half the dining experience.)I've had the pizza and the duck club. Both are very good. The setting is nice and the location is about perfect. I like the patio and bar area more than the main dining room.My reasons for a 3 instead of a 4 or higher? The prices strike me as about 15 percent higher than they should be. And the staff has never blown me away. My last waiter was extremely goofy and unapologetically slow
column3: especially since it wasn't even a capacity crowd.The Parlor is one of those places that I'll continue to visit every now and again because a) The experience will probably never be awful; and b) my friends and family often call the shots.Hence
column4: a solid 3-star rating.~~#~0

column1: Fry's really helped me out on a recent trip to Phoenix as I was able to get my natural healthy items that I live on back in Seattle
column2: They had a great stock of Larabars
column3: So delicious coconut milk ice cream and my Bobs Redmill Almond Flour for some snicker Doodles I was hoping to make. What really hurt was their Sushi. I had heard great things about the Sushi bar but when I got there I saw piles and piles of prepackaged rolls and nagiri. As I looked over the ingredients
column4: there was nothing but Whey
column5: Lecithin's more preservatives that do not belong in sushi. Sushi should be "Fresh." I'm not a fan of conveyor belt establishments
column6: and even less excited to grab a plastic clamshell ToGo box. Needless to say
column7: I am still fending for a great place to grab Sushi while in Phoenix. HELP!!!~~#~0

column1: Chaos
column2: but in a good way.~~#~0

column1: went there last night
column2: after a rotten day and dinner at La Bocca. fairly good band playing
column3: quite the indie scenester crowd(a bit irritating
column4: but pretty much what I expected). $4.50 for a Jack and diet coke is...pretty f**king steep
column5: but I still bought three and left feeling pretty good.~~#~0

column1: Last night I tweeted asking for dinner recommendations in the Gilbert area.  I did get a few responses thanks to @ericeatsout and @lynnekingsmith
column2: but we were actually pretty far out in the middle of nowhere
column3: so we ended up finding our way to Pho Ao Sen on our way home instead.  The restaurant itself is clean and has an upscale feel to it compared to most of the other Vietnamese restaurants in town.  Service was friendly
column4: but we found the menu a bit limited and the quality of the meat not amazing.  We started with the (#2)Goi Cuon- Spring Roll appetizer (minus the pork).  They came out quickly and were really good.  For our entrees
column5: I had the (#7) Korean style beef short ribs and Jared went for the (#21) Pho Ga (aka Chicken Noodle Soup).  We both agreed entrees were just alright.  I also had a coconut juice beverage which I later learned came from a can.  Bottom line: Is this place "simply PHO'nomenal" as their tagline says?  Not so much... and we probably won't be rushing back anytime soon
column6: but it was A-OK.~~#~0

column1: I chose BLT for my birthday dinner a few weeks ago. We were given a  table with an excellent view and our server started off great. He recommended a few different cocktails and told us about the daily specials. The popovers were amazing and I loved that they gave us the recipe to them. I'm eager to try and recreate these masterpieces in my own kitchen.My oysters were fresh
column2: the sides we chose (the asparagus and the Potato Gratin) were both were excellent. The only problem was our steaks were barely luke warm when we received them. They were cooked to our preferences
column3: but both were almost cold. We attempted to send them back but it seemed at that point our waiter disappeared. After several minutes of trying to make eye contact with someone working we decided to just eat before the rest of our food got cold. I had great expectations for BLT
column4: unfortunately the cold steaks and lackluster service at the end will not justify a return visit. I'm still going with 3 stars
column5: because steaks aside everything else was great.~~#~0

column1: While the store was a bit disheveled as we walked through it
column2: they had some pretty awesome sales going on plus I was able to print a couple of good coupons online
column3: so my savings were pretty fantastic.  :) I usually like to walk through aisles and browse through items without having to step over piles of things or worry that item dangling from the top shelf will fall and injure me in some freak craft accident.   However
column4: the service I received both times I visited the store this week from the framing department was phenomenal!  I am pretty bummed I didn't catch either of the staff member's names who assisted me as I would like to give them the proper shout-out.  They were very helpful
column5: knowledgeable and went through some extra effort to meet my deadline. (Yes
column6: I had a deadline for a frame.  Please don't judge me.)  All in all
column7: I would return to this store to check out their store clearance items and for framing.  All else (scrapbooking
column8: baking
column9: etc.) would be a "maybe".~~#~0

column1: I don't really like going to this theater because it's conjoined to not only a huge mall but also game works. But
column2: alas
column3: you can bet you'll find a parking space - you just may have to walk a little bit. The theater is clean
column4: easy to find and plays the hottest new releases.I saw Spider Man 3 here at opening day
column5: midnight. I expected alot more of a snafu
column6: but it was efficient enough that my friend and I got some really great seats - never mind having our butts go numb from sitting for 5 hours. I've been back since the premiere. It's a very easy place to find (so close to my place) so I think that's why I go.~~#~0

column1: Is this place full of douchebags?  OF COURSE it is
column2: it's Scottsdale.That being said
column3: this place consistently brings world class DJ's (Donald Gladue anyone? DJ Icey... hello?) that you won't find anywhere else in Phoenix and a good deal for $10 before 11pm or whatever it is.  Usually the morons there don't realize the talent that's behind the decks so there is a decent amount of room on the dance floor... plus it never gets old watching people "freak" to dirty breakbeats.  lol.  idiots.Yeah drinks are pricey
column4: but nothing compared to $14-$18 vodka tonics in Los Angeles... plus we're ghetto and usually bring a flask in anyway.  But then again
column5: I'm not there to socialize or drink
column6: I'm there to hear good music.The downstairs lounge area is perfect when you need to chill out and I never have a problem finding a seat.  Even though there are usually "Reserved" place cards on the tables I just assume they're reserved for me and have never been hassled.I wish they had some dope drum'n'bass acts there
column7: but I always wish that of every place and it never comes true.~~#~0

column1: When Yupha's used to be on Elliott and Hardy their prices were lower and the portions were bigger.  Now they are at Elliott and McClintock
column2: and with the move came a price hike along with a reduction in the amount of food they served.  For me
column3: they have priced themselves out of my regular rotation.  The food is still tasty enough when I am in the area

column1: I thought the place was okay

column4: although there are many similar and better places already.I got the California sandwich
column5: being from California
column6: of course. (Turkey
column7: Swiss
column8: sprouts
column9: tomato

column2: wet
column3: with mozzarella cheese
column4: mine with sweet peppers. It was good...decent...nothing spectacular. The beef was seasoned well and very tender. We ordered them 'wet' because that's what the sign said they recommend
column5: but personally

column1: Sort of fast food

column3: it's automatically a double patty. If you want something smaller (a single)

column5: a Regular fries will definitely feed 2 people because they dump all kinds of extra fries in the bag too.  -The burgers are MESSY...but I kind of liked it. They were messy-good.Overall
column6: Five Guys is solid. I enjoyed my burger
column7: and the fries were done well too. However

column1: A solid three stars
column2: I think! No
column3: it's NOT the authentic Hakata-style ramen I crave but it's not the 25cent kind either! The noodles are REALLY well done and the broths (tonkatsu
column4: spicy tonkatsu and the shoyu) were very tasty and full of flavor. The toppings in the traditional style leave a lot to be desired and the pork is NOT chashu-style.The boba drinks are nice and the service was pretty good. Overall
column5: I'd give them another try.~~#~0

column1: With 130 food items on the menu
column2: there's plenty to choose from. I went with the BBQ pork fried rice. What I got was an enormous portion of fried rice with pork - definitely enough to satisfy my hunger. Not the greatest food around
column3: but good enough to come back and sample some of the other 129 items.  And with prices hovering around the $5-6 range
column4: it's very affordable.~~#~0

column1: Saturday's trip made it out second to Lenny's.  The burger I had had WAY too much mayo on it.  Fries were good.  J liked his chili cheese dogs.  If we're ever in the area again
column2: we'll probably go again.  And I'll probably try a different buger - and tell them to go easy on the mayo.~~#~0

column1: Federico's has been the 24hr place to eat in this neighborhood for as long as i can remember.  The portions are large and they have a help your self salsa bar.  My wife likes to get the cheese quesadia and i like to get the Carnitas burito.  The place is clean and the food is decent. What more can you ask for in a fast food Mexican joint.~~#~0
I'm not a big "breakfast" fan so it sways my rating a bit.  This place was really crowded when I went.  Overall it was good
column2: the best I've found in PHX so far.  If I was looking for breakfast I'd go back.~~#~0

column1: I went here on a Groupon NOW promotion and when I went it
column2: the owner explained to me they were not honoring the Groupon which was kind of annoying cause now I have to get my money refunded through Groupon and she didn't offer any sort of discount to compensate.I wanted to try it out regardless and I'm glad I stuck around.  The food is made fresh and is GOOD. Honest
column3: good
column4: healthy and good.  They were running low on staff when we went but the owner came out and apologized.We had the chips and guac
column5: which was ok.The salads were good.  I had the Beijing with Chicken

column1: Delux
column2: seriously. It's well-done. The kitchen stays open until 2am and the Grilled Cheese is out of this "californian cuisine" galaxy. column1: Disappointing. Rock Bottom has all the makings of a quality bar and grill but just doesn't deliver quite like I thought it would.At places like this
column2: I have two main expectations: 1) Good beer with lots of it on tap. 2) Good bar food. And it goes one for two. The beer is tasty and cold
column3: as it should be
column4: but the bar food didn't do it for me. Burgers are a little awkward
column5: think greasy bar burgers with bleu cheese. It just didn't float my boat. The service is always good and it's a better place to drink than to eat
column6: even the desserts and appetizers are good
